title: Kidney Disease-Heart Failure Link May Be Traced To A Tiny Toxin, Study Finds - KFF Health News
summary_full: Kidney Disease-Heart Failure Link May Be Traced To A Tiny Toxin, Study Finds  KFF Health NewsScientists finally may know why kidney patients die of heart disease  The Washington PostMore than half of people with advanced kidney disease develop cardiovascular problems. A new study finds that diseased kidneys release tiny particles that are toxic to the heart.  facebook.comUVA researcher studies kidney-heart disease connection, finding toxic link  WVIRQ&A: How Chronic Kidney Disease Drives Cardiovascular Risk Beyond Traditional Factors  Pharmacy Times
